comment: I have taken Dr. Pournaghshand for both an undergrad and a grad course. As long as you follow the instructions and turn in college-level work, his courses are easy A's. He is very reasonable, responsive, and seems like a cool guy. Both of the courses I took were 100% online. Tests were open note.
Very nice professor, responds to emails within a 24 hour timeline. Light work, and tests and quizzes are all open-note, which is nice.

Professor Pournaghshand was fairly communicative and made all tests/quizzes open-note, which was very helpful. There's not a lot of direction for the essential core grade of the class-the group project-so most of the class depends on how good your group is.

Using the textbook itself gives most of the answers for the quizzes/tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: This class wasn't very hard. It was pretty light on assignments and discussion posts. The main thing was a group project, but I think that's just required for the class -- not professor specific. He didn't seem to grade to harshly and didn't make the class harder than it needed to be.

Barely any interaction with the professor. Posts very poorly made lectures and assigns reading. The grade is semester long group project, 4 tests, and 2 assignments. The assignments and project are simple (just fill out the templates). The tests have poorly made/worded questions but are based on the readings. If you know the reading you'll do fine.

Very little effort on his part. Only post PowerPoint slides and gives you an assignment every once in a while. There is also a semester-long project that's not bad. He also grades your assignments and test but provides NO FEEDBACK. I had to email him about my exam to figure out what I had missed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: First off, he's one of the nicest professors I've ever had. Reached out to him a couple times with technical issues and he was very understanding. The class itself is a little dreary, but its not his fault, just the material being covered. There's a semester long group project that's easy enough. Overall, a very solid choice.

His grading criteria wasn't clear for assignments and project documents, and he didnt even give good feedback, so I rarely knew what I did wrong. He also didnt record lectures and just posted powerpoint slides online. It seems like he doesnt really put much effort into actually teaching this class. He was just there to put in some grades.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Pournaghshband is a great caring professor. I am not even an SWE major, took one of his classes and was able to pass with an A. Tests are very reasonable (read his PowerPoint slides and take notes and that is all you need). Also participate in online discussions and be actively involved in group projects and you will have A.

Pretty Straightforward class. Weekly readings, 2 tests, and a project. He is a pretty easy grader, but make sure you ask questions and read the material promptly. There is only an hour limit for both open note exams, but if you read all the material, you should be fine. Just do everything on time and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Pournaghshband's class is extremely organized and structured, you need to take care of the weekly assigned tasks, group project, research paper and 2 exams to pass the course. The class seems hard from the outsider's perspective but isn't really, if you are punctual and dedicated.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Class isn't too difficult. You have to read weekly materials (PowerPoint slides, notes, etc.) and corresponding Chapters/Sections of the textbook. There are two exams (midterm & final) and one group project- and that's pretty much your whole grade. Just submit everything and you should be good.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Pournaghshband is a great teacher. He truly know his stuff and willing to help when you're in need. Nice guy. There were 5 assignments, a midterm and a final all online- for the online course, of course. There's a set day and time to complete exams, and 2 hours to complete. Review assignments and slides and you'll do fine on those.

His online class is 100% online, 100%!. But he still makes you come to class for the proctored exam. The test is 60% of your grade, so do not mess up on the mid term and final exam or you will be in a horrible position. You have been warn.

He has two test, two assignments, and a group project. He is lenient on grading as long as you can write something down that is relevant. Make sure you study the powerpoints because that is basically what the class is about. Study the powerpoints for the exams and you will do fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Barely know the guy. Took the online class. He posts powerpoints online for you to read. Doesn't even have lectures to watch. Class has a big project to do, but it is pretty simple. Go over the powerpoints well to do well on tests. Easy grader. Despite being an online class you are asked to attend tests in person.

Lectures are very hard to sit through, as they're read word-for-word from a PowerPoint. Tests are not incredibly difficult, but it would be easier if the lectures weren't so hard to muster. You're on your own for group work, though he's very lenient with grading. Overall, very easy professor but also difficult to learn from.

lecture is merely reading slides word by word. However, a robot does a better job because machine language doesn't have accent. Slides poorly organized and prepared with typos and formatting issues. no emphasis. Said everything is students responsibility to study for exams. assignments have zero to do with exams. Super tough on grading exams.
